data.question: What is the photothermal conversion efficiency of Py@Ca-NDI in aqueous solution?
What materials were used as the electron donor and acceptor in the construction of the MOF-stabilized co-crystals?
data.answer: Pyrene was used as the electron donor and naphthalene diimide (NDI) as the electron acceptor.

data.question: How does the photothermal conversion efficiency of Py@Ca-NDI compare to the FDA approved photothermal agent ICG?
data.answer: Py@Ca-NDI has a higher photothermal conversion efficiency than ICG.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of Py@Ca-NDI involves a modified solvothermal reaction.
What is the intermolecular distance between the charge transfer pairs in the MOF structure?
What effect does the encapsulation of pyrene into the Ca-NDI MOF have on the absorption spectrum?
data.answer: It results in intense absorption from 450 to 800 nm, indicating the occurrence of charge transfer interaction between NDI and pyrene.

data.question: True or False: The host–guest MOF material Py@Ca-NDI can be used for biological applications in photothermal therapy.
What is the role of the metal nodes in the MOF structure?
data.answer: Biocompatible Ca2+ ions serve as the metal nodes in the MOF structure.

data.question: True or False: The stability of organic co-crystals in aqueous solution is not a concern for their biological applications.
What was the observed temperature rise of Py@Ca-NDI under NIR laser irradiation in solid-crystal form?
data.answer: A temperature rise of 43.2°C was observed in five minutes.

data.question: How does the photothermal performance of Py@Ca-NDI in aqueous solution compare to a mixed solution of pyrene/NDI?
data.answer: Py@Ca-NDI aqueous solution has a significantly higher temperature increase than the mixed solution of pyrene/NDI under the same conditions.

data.question: True or False: The photothermal conversion efficiency of Py@Ca-NDI is lower than most of the reported MOFs.
What was the method used to prepare the aqueous dispersible Py@Ca-NDI?
data.answer: The aqueous dispersible Py@Ca-NDI were prepared via grounding the as-synthesized co-crystal MOF.

data.question: True or False: The photothermal effect of Py@Ca-NDI in aqueous solution can be controlled by the concentration of Py@Ca-NDI and the power intensity of the NIR laser.
What was the calculated photothermal conversion efficiency (PCE) of Py@Ca-NDI under specific conditions?
data.answer: The PCE of Py@Ca-NDI under specific conditions was calculated to be 41.8%.

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that the MOF structure can stabilize and enhance the charge-transfer interaction of co-crystals in aqueous solution.
How does the photothermal effect of Py@Ca-NDI contribute to its application in photothermal therapy?
data.answer: The superior photothermal effect of Py@Ca-NDI, demonstrated by its high photothermal conversion efficiency, enables its effective use in photothermal therapy for cancer treatment.

data.question: True or False: The study provided a proof-of-concept validation of the biological application of MOF co-crystal in vitro and in vivo via photothermal tumor ablation experiments.
What was the observed effect of Py@Ca-NDI on tumor growth in the in vivo PTT study?
data.answer: Tumor growth was significantly inhibited in the experimental group treated with Py@Ca-NDI and NIR laser irradiation.

data.question: True or False: The study's findings suggest that the modular nature of MOFs can be exploited for a wide range of biological applications beyond photothermal therapy.
